Name: Statuette of Isis
Description: Statuette representing the enthroned goddess Isis, holding the infant Horus in her lap. Isis is dressed in a long ankle-length tunic and is wearing a wesekh-collar. On her head are a tripartite wig and a crown of uraei on top of which are the solar disc and horns. The naked child also wears a wesekh-collar, and a lock of youth and uraeus. The details, like the wig, the lock and the wesekh-collars are indicated by means of incisions.
